justification: The Trust Game task was used to assess social decision making, specifically how participants (young and older adults) share money with different types of partners (close friend, stranger, computer).
The Shared Reward Task measured reward processing in social contexts by requiring participants to guess the value of a card and share potential monetary wins or losses with different partners.

The Ultimatum Game task was used to assess perceptions of and responses to fair or unfair offers from proposers, evaluating participants' decisions (accept or reject) based on the fairness of the offer.
